Create Pair Mapping

Source: R/metrics.R
create_pair_mapping.Rd

Create an item pair mapping for calculate_nb.

Usage

create_pair_mapping(items)

Arguments

items

Vector of items for the design

Value

Named vector of item pairs as a character separated by ",":

  • "<item 2>,<item 1>" - "<item 1>,<item 2>"

  • "<item 3>,<item 1>" - "<item 1>,<item 3>"

  • ...

  • ",<item 1>" - "<item 1>,"

  • ",<item 1>" - "<item 1>,"

  • "<item 3>,<item 2>" - "<item 2>,<item 3>"

  • "<item 4>,<item 2>" - "<item 2>,<item 4>"

  • ...

  • ",<item 2>" - "<item 2>,"

  • ",<item 2>" - "<item 2>,"

  • ...

  • "," - ","

  • "<item 1>,<item 1>" - "<item 1>,<item 1>"

  • "<item 2>,<item 2>" - "<item 2>,<item 2>"

  • ...

  • "," - ","

  • "," - ","

Examples

treatments <- c(rep(1:10, 4), rep(11:16, 3), rep(17:27, 2))
create_pair_mapping(treatments)
#>     2,1     3,1     4,1     5,1     6,1     7,1     8,1     9,1    10,1    11,1 
#>   "1,2"   "1,3"   "1,4"   "1,5"   "1,6"   "1,7"   "1,8"   "1,9"  "1,10"  "1,11" 
#>    12,1    13,1    14,1    15,1    16,1    17,1    18,1    19,1    20,1    21,1 
#>  "1,12"  "1,13"  "1,14"  "1,15"  "1,16"  "1,17"  "1,18"  "1,19"  "1,20"  "1,21"
